Maladies Treated: Atrophic lung disease with vomiting blood
Constipation (see formula for method: use stir fried lai fu with zao jia powder)
Medical Function: Alcohol extract possesses antibiotic property, especially toward Gram positive bacteria; but in serum, the viability is only 50%
The juice of the radix of this plant can prevent the forming of gall stones and being used in gall stone disease
Samples of Formulae:
For atrophic lung disease with vomiting blood: use lai fu (萊菔) with goat meat or carp to make soup. Take frequently.

Constipation: stir fry one cup of lai fu (萊菔). Add water and blend into paste. Add zao jia (皂夾, gleditsia fruit) 7.5 g (make into powder). Take orally.
Contraindications: Do not use with he shou wu (何首烏, polygonum multiflorum) or di huang (地黃, rehmannia root).
Research: Using the acid substance of lai fu (萊菔) of 3g/kg for hypodermic injection or 2g/kg for abdominal cavity injection to mice did not show toxicity. Using 1g/kg for hypodermic injection on rabbits only showed mild, temporary toxic reaction.

Name: yan fu mu
鹽膚木
Biological: Rhus chinensis Mill. var. roxburghii (DC) Rehd (濱鹽膚木)
Other name: yan fu zi mu 鹽膚子木

fei tian wu gong 飛天蜈蚣

Geography: In China, found in all provinces except Inner Mongolia, Qinghai, and Xinjiang.
Maladies Treated: External application: burns and local bleeding
Medical Function: Wu bei zi (galla chinensis): Astringes to stop bleeding, astringes the lungs and descends fire, astringes sweating and binds the intestines
Dosage:
Root: 10 to 35 g. 
Wu bei zi (galla chinensis): 2 to 7 g. 
Flower and leaves for external application: use appropriate amount.
Notes: Parts being used in medicine: roots, leaves, flowers, fruit and wu bei zi (galla chinensis). They are collected in summer and fall.

Name: yang qi shi
陽起石
Chemical: It is not a simple compound. The actinolite containing silicate (SiO4) of minerals in general (including other silicon-containing salt, such as metasilicate, wollastonite CaSiO3 example). Can be seen as SiO2 and other oxides (mostly a combination of metal oxides).

Maladies Treated: uterine bleeding due to cold and deficiency
下焦虛寒 (lower energizer deficiency-cold pattern)
aching and weakness in loin and knees
Medical Function: Untreated yang qi shi is being used in shenyangxu (kidney yang deficient).
Contraindications:
Not to use in case of yin deficient with heat.
According to the medical classics Ben Cao Jing Ji Zhu, use with sang piao xiao (mantis egg-case). Not compatible with ze xie (Alisma tuber), rou gui (cinnamon bark), lei wan (Omphalia fungus), she tui (snake molt skin). Counteracts with tu si zi (dodder seed).
According to the medical classics, Yao Xing Lun (Theory on herb characteristics), it antagonizes shi kui (Bryophyllum pinnatum), goat and lamb meat.
According to the medical classics, Ben Cao Jing Su, not to use in case of yin deficient with heat. In case of impotence caused by emotional injuries and those with heavy bleeding not during menses and those with vaginal discharge due to heat and not cold and weakness.
According to the medical classics, Ben Cao Hui Yan, those with yinxu (yin deficient) blood with heat syndrome should not take the herb. 陰虚火旺者忌服。《本草經集注》：「桑螵蛸為之使。惡澤瀉、肉桂、雷丸、蛇蛻皮。畏菟絲子。」《藥性論》：「惡石葵。忌羊血。」《本草經疏》：「陰虚火旺者忌之。陽痿屬於失志，以致火氣閉密不得發越而然，及崩中帶下由於火盛而非虛寒者，並不得服。」《本草匯言》：「yinxu (yin deficient)  陰虛  血熱者不宜服。」
Chemical Ingredients: mainly calcium, magnesium, and iron hydroxyl silicate Ga2 (Mg,Fe2+)5[Si4O11]2(OH)2 (tremolite)
contains a small amount of calcite, or a combination of amphibole and chlorite (magnesium iron aluminum silicon aluminate)

Medical Function: Antibiotic effect: In vitro experiments showed that ethanol, petroleum ether, ethyl acetate extract of quan shen (拳參) and polygonum glycosides, gallic acid and other monomer components possessed the inhibition activities on Staphylococcus aureus, Escherichia coli, Bacillus subtilis and Pseudomonas aeruginosa, etc. Among them the extract of ethyl acetate and that of gallic acid possessed the strongest antibiotic activity.

Anti-inflammatory effect: Oral administration of the ethanol extract of quan shen (拳參) and the substances isolated from quan shen, 5-glutinen-3-one and friedelanol could inhibit the edema of rat paws induced by carrageenan.

Analgesic effect: In mice experiment, using acetic acid writhing, pain caused by hot plate method and by electrical shock method, showed that quan shen (拳參) butanol extract and water extract when injected intraperitoneally produced significant analgesic effect.

Sedative effect: Intraperitoneal injection of quan shen (拳參) butanol extract in mice significantly inhibited the spontaneous activity, and could also significantly enhance the sedative effect of sodium pentobarbital on central nervous system.
The chemical ingredient of quan shen (拳參) L-epicatechin can significantly reduce acetylcholinesterase activity, and can reduce serum and liver cholesterol.
Quan shen (拳參) also possesses the effect of anti-mutation, anti-cancer, inhibition of tumor necrosis factor (TNF), anti-endotoxin.
Dosage: 4.5 to 9 g. External application: use appropriate amount. 4.5～9g。外用適量，煎湯含漱。
Contraindications: Use with care if there is not strong heat syndrome. 無實火實熱者慎服。
Research:
Antibiotic effect: In vitro experiments showed that ethanol, petroleum ether, and ethyl acetate extract of quan shen (拳參) and polygonum glycosides, gallic acid and other monomer components possessed inhibitory activities on Staphylococcus aureus, Escherichia coli, Bacillus subtilis and Pseudomonas aeruginosa, etc. Ethyl acetate extract and gallic acid possessed the strongest antibiotic activity.

Anti-inflammatory effect: Oral administration of the ethanol extract of quan shen (拳參) and substances isolated from quan shen, 5-glutinen-3-one and friedelanol could inhibit the edema of rat paws induced by carrageenan.

Analgesic effect: In mice experiments, using acetic acid writhing, hot plate method, and electrical shock method, it was shown that quan shen (拳參) butanol extract and water extract injected intraperitoneally produced significant analgesic effect.

Sedative effect: Intraperitoneal injection of quan shen (拳參) butanol extract in mice significantly inhibited spontaneous activity, and significantly enhanced the sedative effect of sodium pentobarbital on the central nervous system.

The chemical ingredient L-epicatechin from quan shen (拳參) can significantly reduce acetylcholinesterase activity, and reduce rat serum and liver cholesterol.

Quan shen (拳參) also has demonstrated effects as anti-mutation, anti-cancer, inhibition of tumor necrosis factor (TNF), and anti-endotoxin.
Notes: quan shen (拳參) is not qi ye yi zhi hua (七葉一枝花, Paris polyphylla Smith var. chinensis (Franch.) Hara) and is not chong lou (重樓, Paris polyphylla Smith var. yunnanensis (Franch.) Hand. Mazz.). quan shen is the rhizome of Polygonum bistorta L. or Polygonum Lapidosum Kitag.

Anti-inflammatory effect Oral administration of the ethanol extract of quan shen and the substances isolated from quan shen,  5-glutinen-3-one and friedelanol could inhibit the edema of rat paws induced by carrageenan [4, 8] .3. Analgesic effect In mice experiment, using acetic acid writhing, pain caused by hot plate method and by electrical shock method, showed that quan shen  butanol extract and water extract when injected intraperitoneally produced significant analgesic effect. 4. Sedative effect Using  Intraperitoneal injection of quan shen butanol extract in mice significantly inhibited the spontaneous activity, and could also significantly enhance the sedative effect of sodium pentobarbital on CNS . 5. Other The chemical ingredient of quan shen L-epicatechin can  significantly reduce acetylcholinesterase activity, and can reduce serum and liver cholesterol. Name: pu huang
蒲黃
Biological: Typha angustifolia L. 水燭香蒲
Typha angustata Bory et Chauberd 長苞香蒲
Other name: pu li hua fen 蒲厘花粉
pu bang hua fen 蒲棒花粉

Properties: 炒味澀 (slightly astringent taste when fried)
Maladies Treated: inflammation of the intestine and difficulty in urination: use pu huang 50 g, xiong huang (realgar) 10 g, bing pian (borneol) 3 g, fresh white part of green onion 200 g (wash the part of green onion and boil in water for 3 minutes. Smash all herb and paste it to the lower abdomen while still warm)

bleeding and abdomen ache due to chronic colitis: pu huang 3 g, wu ling zhi (Trogopterus dung) 3 g (wrap in cloth), baked ge gen (kudzu root) 10 g, baked rou dou kou (nutmeg) 3 g. Make into decoction and use as tea
external injury of the head with swelling: use raw pu huang and apply to the injury, 3 times a day
inflammation of the rib cartilage (without pus)
Medical Function: stops bleeding; shortens blood coagulation time
raw pu huang possesses double effects of stopping bleeding and promoting circulation
hei pu huang (pu huang that has been stir fried till dark color) is used in stopping bleeding
Dosage: 3 to 10 g. Wrap and boil with water. 3～10克，包煎。
Samples of Formulae:
Inflammation of the intestine and difficulty in urination: pu huang 50 g, xiong huang (realgar) 10 g, bing pian (borneol) 3 g, fresh white part of green onion 200 g (wash green onion, boil in water 3 minutes, smash all herb and apply as a warm paste to the lower abdomen).

Bleeding and abdomen ache due to chronic colitis: pu huang 3 g, wu ling zhi (Trogopterus dung) 3 g (wrap in cloth), baked ge gen (kudzu root) 10 g, baked rou dou kou (nutmeg) 3 g. Make into decoction and use as tea.

External injury of the head with swelling: use raw pu huang and apply to injury, 3 times a day.
Contraindications:
Not to use in cases of bleeding due to blood stasis and during pregnancy. Because raw pu huang can constrict uterus, pregnant women should avoid using it; but it can be used in bleeding due to lack of constriction after giving birth.

The herb can be toxic to the liver.

瘀滯出血及孕婦忌服。 生蒲黄有收缩子宫的作用，故孕婦忌服， 但可用于產後子宫收缩不良的出血。

本品對肝臟有毒。
